== ValidateThis QuickStart Guide ==

Follow these simple steps to get started using the framework:

# Download the framework from [http://validatethis.riaforge.org validatethis.riaforge.org].
# Unzip the contents of the distribution into a folder on your machine. You can place this folder in your webroot, or place it elsewhere and create a mapping to it called ''ValidateThis''.
# Copy the JavaScript files from ''/client/jQuery/js/'' into a folder that will be accessible by your web pages (e.g., /js/ off your web root).
# Create a [[Rules Definition File]] for a Business Object for which you want ValidateThis to generate validations. Take a look at the [[Sample Rules Definition File]] for an example.
# In your application code, create a [[ValidateThisConfig Struct]], and then instantiate the [[ValidateThis Facade Object | ValidateThis.cfc facade object]], passing in the struct, like so:

<source lang="coldfusion">
<cfset ValidateThisConfig = {JSRoot="/js/",definitionPath="/model/"} />
<cfset application.ValidateThis = createObject("component","ValidateThis.ValidateThis").init(ValidateThisConfig) />
</source>

Where:
* ''JSRoot'' points to the folder into which you copied the JavaScript files in step 3
* ''definitionPath'' points to the folder into which you placed your [[Rules Definition File]] in step 4

<br/>
More information on the keys that can be used in the ValidateThisConfig struct is available under [[ValidateThisConfig Struct | Configuring the Framework]].

<br/>
You will now be able to call methods on the ValidateThis facade object to perform server-side and generate client-side validations.

For example, to perform server-side validations on an object, use the ''validate()'' method:

<source lang="coldfusion">
<cfset Result = application.ValidateThis.validate(myObject) />
</source>

<br/>
To generate client-side validations, use the ''getValidationScript()'' method:

<source lang="coldfusion">
<cfset theScript = application.ValidateThis.getValidationScript(theObject=myObject) />
<cfhtmlhead text="#theScript#" />
</source>

<br/>
Note that for many of the built-in validation types you'll also have to include some initialization Javascript which is generated by calling the ''getInitializationScript()'' method:

<source lang="coldfusion">
<cfset initScript = application.ValidateThis.getInitializationScript() />
<cfhtmlhead text="#initScript#" />
</source>

<br/>
For more information on interacting with the ValidateThis.cfc facade object, see the section on [[ValidateThis Facade Object | Using the ValidateThis Facade Object]].
